intro: Godetia amoena var. concolor, commonly known as the pink godetia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, single flowers that are typically pink to lavender in color, with five petals and a prominent yellow center. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and ability to bloom throughout the summer months.
